terms.name: Acorn
terms.description: Small nut that is produced by oak trees. Has a cap on top resembling a beanie

terms.name: Alternate
terms.description: Leaves or buds staggered along the twigs or branches

terms.name: Bud
terms.description: A small protrusion found either on the end or sides of the trees twigs, this is the point from which the trees leaves or flowers will grow

terms.name: Bundle scar
terms.description: The dots inside a leaf scar

terms.name: End bud
terms.description: Buds which grow at the very tip of the twig growing straight out; sometimes referred to as true end buds

terms.name: False end bud
terms.description: Do not have a true end bud, end buds appear to be bent, small or set off to the side

terms.name: Flower Bud
terms.description: A bud that will turn into a flower as opposed to a leaf

terms.name: Fruit
terms.description: The seed containing a pod, nut, samara, berry, or more traditional fleshy fruit (ie. apple or orange)

terms.name: Furrows
terms.description: The grooves or channels in the trees bark

terms.name: Inner bark
terms.description: Inner most part of the bark attached to the tree’s trunk

terms.name: Leaf scar
terms.description: The mark left on a twig when the leaf is removed

terms.name: Lobed
terms.description: A leaf with multiple rounded portions along the edge (ie. hand with fingers spread apart)

terms.name: Opposite
terms.description: Leaves and twigs which grow out exactly across from one another

terms.name: Samara
terms.description: A dry, seeded, 'winged' fruit. The fruit of maples, ashes, and elms

terms.name: Scale
terms.description: Minute leaves that are needle-like or flat and overlapping like reptilian skin

terms.name: Thorn
terms.description: A sharp-pointed, woody outgrowth of the internal vascular system of the plant

terms.name: Twig
terms.description: The newer growth off a branch, varies in colors different than the branch’s bark where the buds are found

terms.name: Un-lobed
terms.description: A leaf without lobes (ie. hand with fingers NOT spread apart)
